message: You can't get through this dense fog here.
The fog vanishes completely as soon as you touch its heart.
The fog vanishes completely as soon as you touch its heart.
The fog vanishes completely as soon as you touch its heart.
The fog vanishes completely as soon as you touch its heart.
The fog vanishes completely as soon as you touch its heart.
Me and my brothers watch over the ruler of the swamp.

replies.text: Not for long, some of your brothers have all left the area already. Attack!
So I'm going to talk to your remaining brothers.

message: Me and my brothers watch over the ruler of the swamp.

replies.text: Your brothers have all left the area already. Now to you ...
So I'm going to talk to your brothers.

message: Me and my brothers watch over the ruler of the swamp.

replies.text: So I'm going to talk to your brothers.

message: You can't defeat me as long as my brothers stand their ground.

replies.text: Well, in that case stay here. I'll be back in a minute.

message: "Pay homage to Elythara, radiant queen of the world!"
Below the statue you see an offering bowl.

replies.text: Place 1 gold coin in the bowl.
Place 10 gold coins in the bowl.
Place 100 gold coins in the bowl.
Place 1000 gold coins in the bowl.

message: Your gift will be viewed favorably.
Thank you, in the name of Elythara.
Let your name be praised in the halls of Elythara!
For the greatness of Elythara, our Godess!
Long live Elythara!
You can not undo your evil theft.
Stealing from the goddess Elythara - are you sure?
Stealing from the goddess Elythara - are you sure?
Stealing from the goddess Elythara - are you sure?
Stealing from the goddess Elythara - are you sure?
Elythara is known for her thirst for revenge. Fear her wrath!
Go away - while you still can!
Hello, strange kid. Wanna pass?
Gimme 5 red glassy stones, and I'll open the path for you.

replies.text: Sure, I have plenty of them.
Are 5 shiny gold coins OK too?

message: Did I hear 500?
Good, good! Here you go. But don't waste time.
Coming back soon - Godoe
I think I said: Don't waste time, did I not? Hee hee.
I think I said: Don't waste time, did I not? Hee hee.
The fog over there is very dangerous.

replies.text: Which fog? Do you ever look up?

message: Oh ... Forget it. I feel rather stupid now. Bye.
Who dares disturb my solitude? Be gone, or face my wrath!

replies.text: Sorry. I got lost in the fog.
I am not afraid of you. (You grope for your weapon)

message: Oh, how touching. The brave little hero got himself lost, did he?
And now he expects me to help him? Ha!

replies.text: No. I can handle myself as always.
I managed to defeat the fog monsters that caused it.

message: Defeated my fog monsters, did you? Meddlesome brat!
Those creatures were my only protection from unwanted visitors like you!

replies.text: I didn't know. The fog was disorienting ...
I'm sorry, I didn't mean to disturb you.
Not much of a protection they were.

message: And?

replies.text: And I just wanted to find my way to Feygard.
I just want to find my way home.

message: (Grumbles) Lost, you say? It's your own fault for wandering where you don't belong. I prefer to be left alone, away from the meddling of outsiders.

replies.text: I understand, and I'm really sorry. I promise I'll leave as soon as you point me in the right direction.

message: (Grinning wickedly) That is easy. Go outside and far away. As fast as possible.
What?

replies.text: ... despite what I always have heard about witches in the swamp.

message: (Gruffly) Kind? Bah! I simply don't want the likes of you lingering around here.
Now, listen carefully, child. I will wait a few minutes before I create new fog again.
Be sure to be out of the area.

replies.text: I appreciate your help. I promise I'll be away for good. But can I ask you something else before I leave?

message: (Sighs) Make it quick, then. I don't have all night.

replies.text: Why do you live all alone in this swamp? Don't you ever get lonely?

message: Men used to laugh at me. They threw stones at me and at last tried to burn my house.
All I want is peace and enjoy my lovely garden outside.

replies.text: Eh, yes, your garden is beautiful.

message: How dare you!
Yes, it is. At least one person who knows beauty when he sees it.
Well, I shall spare you... this time. Now leave my sight and never return!

replies.text: It was sort of nice to meet you.

message: Loneliness is a price I'm willing to pay for my solitude.
People fear me because of my powers, and I grow weary of their endless superstitions and suspicions. Here, far from any village, I can be myself without interference.
Here I have found peace at last.

replies.text: I'm sorry people treat you that way. But maybe if they got to know you, they wouldn't be so afraid.

message: Bah! Humans will always fear what they don't understand.

replies.text: Maybe you are right. Let me think ...
Right. And now you should fear me - attack!

message: Hmph, fine. But be quick about it.

replies.text: Shrink the fog in the north.

message: (Eyeing him suspiciously) What?!

replies.text: People have trouble that the way to Feygard goes through your fog. If you make your fog a little smaller in the north, nobody will bother you anymore.

message: Hmm. Sounds reasonable.
Agreed. Here child, take these sweets and now begone!

replies.text: (grumbling) Sweets - I am no kid any more.

message: (Eyeing him suspiciously) What?!

replies.text: People have trouble that the way to Feygard is barred by your fog. No fog on the road, no reason to visit you.

message: Hmm. Sounds reasonable.

replies.text: And being a witch, you can certainly put a spell around your swamp that will distract people from wanting to come here.

message: Swamp! what did you name my beautiful peace of land??
A distraction spell. That I didn't think of it myself ...
Great. You deserve a reward for that. You may choose one thing from these:

replies.text: A vial of healing water from the garden

message: Here take this stuff. And now go and finally leave me alone. TODO
Shop TODO
You have it. And now go and finally leave me alone. Otherwise I'll turn you into a frog.
(Grinning wickedly) I think it's time you learn a lesson, meddling child.

replies.text: What are you going to do?

message: The old witch raises her hands, chanting ominously.
A curse upon you, little one! May darkness be your companion, and fear be your guide!

replies.text: I won't let you curse me! (Draws his sword)
I'm sorry, ma'am. Please forgive me.
Wait! Spare me please. I'll give you ...

message: Hahaha! You? Defeat me? We shall see!
Oh, the heroic little braveheart, off to save his own skin.
What do you offer me?

replies.text: My Ring of the Lesser Shadow  (TODO)

message: Insolence! Just you wait ...
I have no need for that. But I will take it nevertheless.
You again! You promised me peace and solitude!
Oh - how did you pass through my distraction fence?
Go away!

replies.text: OK, sorry for disturbing your peace.
Can I buy more of your medicinal water?

message: Well, if you promise to finally leave me alone afterwards.  TODO
Oh what's this? How unusual!

This area will never be bullied by the old witch again.
You take the witch's staff - maybe it will find a good use as a walking stick.
Only the fog won't go away on its own.
OK.
OK.
Certainly these two mighty ovens were responsible for the thick fog outside.

replies.text: I wonder what would happen if I light a fire?

message: Ah - nice and cozy.
Oh good, somebody comes to help me. Hey kid!
I am Tobby. Please, you must help me.

replies.text: I am $playername. What can I do for you?

message: I can't seem to find my brother, Sobby. He hasn't been back since he left last year.

replies.text: Never mind, he will probably not be back too soon.

message: My father had sent me to look for him. But I dare not pass the cobolds in the ravine.

replies.text: You are sure your brother went that way?

message: Absolutely. Once he was told of a lovely village hidden in the forest to the south east.
Since then not a single day had passed that he hadn't talked of it.
And now he is gone.

replies.text: And you neither dare pass the cobolds, nor tell your father that you give up.

message: Well, yes.
You have come from the south, so you know how to pass these nasty cobolds, do you?
I am glad you want to help me.

replies.text: Sure thing. We brother-seekers must stand together.

message: I just fetch some bread from the house, just a second ...

replies.text: Go ahead. And then let's go south - follow me!

message: Outch, my toes!

replies.text: Go away, or I have to kill you.

message: No, I can't!
Tobby cried out aloud and ran away like the wind. You monster!
Wow, that was an adventure!

replies.text: Was it? I have got used to such things by now.

message: I think that I'll find Sobby by myself now. Thank you - hope we'll meet again!
Hey $playername - great to see you again!

replies.text: Tobby? What are you doing here?

message: Thanks to you I have found my brother Sobby.
Well, due to his rat poison he has lost a few things in here ...
like his gold, his memory, most of his teeth ...
But yes - of course this is Sobby, my brother! Don't you see how we look alike?
Thank you for rescuing us earlier!

replies.text: Your welcome, but I was hoping for more than gratitude.
Your welcome, but I wanted to talk about the "Feydelight" again.
What do I need to do again to get my "Feydelight"?

message: If a reward is what your after, then a reward you shall have.

replies.text: So exciting! I can't wait. Let me have it.

message: Well, maybe with that attitude, you don't derserve one?

replies.text: I'm sorry. You see, I'm just in love with the stuff.

message: Oh, how polite.
Do you know what a "Feydelight" is?

replies.text: Whatever happened to my reward? Thanks for nothing.

message: Well, you see? I make them. Not to brag, but I am in fact, the best baker in Feygard.
[With a not so appreciative look on here face...] Oh, sometimes I miss that magnificent place so much. But I am happier here.

replies.text: I've never been there, but tell me, is it as great as I've been told?

message: I've not the words to begin to describe its magnificence.
Let's get back to talking about those Feydelights.

replies.text: You said that you bake them, but what is a "feydelight"?

message: Child, they are a delicious fig pie enjoyed by most Feygardians as an after dinner delicacy, but most often reserved for holidays and other celebrations.

replies.text: Is that my reward? A fig pie?

message: Well, of course. But there is a problem.
Well, as you are aware, we've been capative for so long. But what you are not aware of, is that while gone, all of my supplies have either gone rotten or been stolen.
I need supplies. Ingredients. To more specific, I need eleven things, but 6 unique ingredients.

Yes. You need to get me some dough, two eggs, butter, honey and five Feygard fig fruits. I also need a bottle of wine. A splash for the pie and the rest of the bottle is for me. Oh don't forget, the figs cannot be found anywhere near those savages to the south.

replies.text: Dough! Where am I supposed to find dough?
I've been across great amount of Dhayavar and I've not seen honey anywhere.

message: Well, Brightport is known for its wondeful bakeries. I would start there. Of course, you could get some in Feygard too.
How about trying a beekeeper? Geez, you are not the smartest are you?
Try a bakery. They always need butter.
Thank you for rescuing us earlier! I would have done it myself but...

replies.text: You did not have the Shadow with you.

message: Now watch it, kid!
The Shadow? You don't believe in that nonsense, do you?

replies.text: Me? No way! I was just kidding. Glory be to Feygard.

message: Glory be to Feygard.
Thank you for rescuing us earlier!
Is that what you do?
You kill just for the thrill?

replies.text: Maybe, but as an adventurer, I like to help where I can.

message: I See, but with those skills of yours, you should train to be a Feygard soldier.

replies.text: Train? I don't need Feygard soldier training. I am already stringer than them.
Oh, that would be my dream job. Protecting the citizens of Dhayavar!

message: [While laughing uncontrollably] But you are just a kid?

replies.text: Um, did you already forget what I can do?

message: Well, when you get a little bit older, you can move to Feygard and attend their soldier training school.

replies.text: Wait. There's a school for learning to be a soldier?

message: Of course there is.

replies.text: Wow! What an amazing place Feygard must be.

message: We are indebted to you now. Your heroicism will never be forgtten by the members of this tiny village.

replies.text: Why do you live in this "tiny village" anyway?

message: That is indeed an excellent question.
Let me explain.
You see, all eight of us were born and raised in the glorious city of Feygard. In fact, we grew up together. Best friends too! But for various resaons, things started to change for us.

replies.text: Really? I am intrigued to hear more.

message: Well, I don't want to speak for everyone else, but for Theodora and I, we began to desire a quieter, more laid back lifestyle.

replies.text: That makes sense. But what about the others?
But do you ever miss it? I mean, if Feygard is so glorious, then you must miss it?

message: Well, like I said before, I don't want to talk for them, but Osric is my best friend, so I know he longed for the days he could raise a garden and live off the land.
Oh, I do miss it a lot. Well, I miss most of it a lot. I miss my family. I miss my old customers coming into my market.
Yeah. I don't miss the noise and the hustle and bustle of the city at all hours of the day. It gets tiresome.

replies.text: Thank you for that. It really helped to hear about Feygard from one of its citizens.

message: Would you like to take a look around the well?

replies.text: No. I don't have time for kid's games. I am not a kid anymore, afterall.
Yes. What would it hurt if I did?

message: As you look around, you say to yourself...

replies.text: There's nothing here. I should go.
This well seems oddly intact compared to the rest of the village. I wonder what's at the bottom of it?

message: You notice some scattered items around the well, as if someone has been throwing things down. Do you want to throw something into the well?

replies.text: No. Why would I want to play a kids game?
I hope this doesn't just anger whatever's down there...

message: You are thinking to yourself now. Trying to decide what you want to throw down into the well...

replies.text: I have nothing else that I am willing to throw down there.

message: Bah! Rock no good! Why throw rock at Gamjee?
Glowing thing... pretty, but useless! Gamjee no care for it!
Very shiny! Sparkly! But still not make Gamjee happy!
Shiny coin? Gamjee not need your shiny! Keep your gold!
You are thinking to yourself now. Trying to decide what else you want to throw down into the well...

replies.text: [Throw a leather boot into the well]
I have nothing else that I am willing to throw down there.

message: A foot thing? What Gamjee do with this? You silly!
Red glass thingy? Hmmm... pretty, but not impress Gamjee!
Shiny gem! Nice, but not enough for Gamjee!
Again, shiny coin? Gamjee not need your shiny trash! Keep your gold!
You are thinking to yourself now. Trying to decide what else you want to throw down into the well...

replies.text: [Throw a piece of rotten meat into the well]
I have nothing else that I am willing to throw down there.

message: Ugh! Stinky meat! Gamjee do want! But you rude!
Very shiny! Sparkly! But still not make Gamjee happy!
Again, shiny coin? Gamjee not need your shiny trash! Keep your gold!
You are thinking to yourself now. Trying to decide what else you want to throw down into the well...

replies.text: I have nothing else that I am willing to throw down there.

message: Sharp gem? What Gamjee do with this? You no make sense!
Bone?! You mock Gamjee?! Me had enough! Die you will.
Again, shiny coin? Gamjee not need your shiny trash! Keep your gold!

Suddenly, a powerful force grabs you and drags you down into the darkness of the well. You find yourself dazed, confused in a dank, underground cavern while bleeding for what feels like every part of your body.
Thank you for rescuing us earlier!

replies.text: How did the troll manage to capture all of you without anyone noticing?

message: The well was enchanted. We felt a strange compulsion to visit it, especially when alone.
The well has been enchanted by the troll. Anyone who draws water from it feels an inexplicable compulsion to keep returning.

replies.text: And you were one to draw water from the well?

message: Yes and every night, I would awake to find myself at the well with no memory of how I got there.
Yes. This happened many times before that thing finally got me.
Thank you! Thank you! We men tried to rescue our wives, but you succeeded. Thank you!

replies.text: How did the troll manage to capture all of you without anyone noticing?

message: Once the women were taken, the troll mimicked their voices, calling out to us men. We thought our wives needed help, but it was a trap.
Each of us was lured by what we thought were our loved ones. By the time we realized the truth, it was too late.

replies.text: But after one of you men was grabbed, how did the last two of you stll fall for this trap?

message: Each of us was taken silently and swiftly. By the time we realized something was wrong, it was too late.

replies.text: I guess that makes some sense.

message: As you begin to traverse the tunnels, the dim light and damp air create an eerie atmosphere. Suddenly, you stop in your tracks.

replies.text: [Thinking]Did I just hear... voices? No, it must be the concussion... or just the echoes playing tricks on me.

message: As you begin to traverse the tunnels, the dim light and damp air create an eerie atmosphere. Suddenly, you stop in your tracks.

replies.text: [Thinking]Did I just hear... voices? No, it's just the echoes playing tricks on me.

message: You press on, the voices you thought you heard earlier seem to be growing louder now. It's hard to tell if they're real or just a figment of your imagination.

replies.text: There it is again... I can't be imagining this, can I? I need to focus.

message: We have to find a way out... this can't be the end for us.
Stay calm, someone will come for us. We must have hope.
Do you hear that? I think someone's coming...

replies.text: [Thinking]They're real! I must be getting closer to whoever these people are. I need to hurry.

message: You enter a larger cavern, the air thick with moisture and the scent of earth. The tunnel opens up to reveal a vast room, dimly lit by glowing fungi on the walls.

replies.text: This must be it... the source of those voices.

message: As you step further into the room, you notice a large pit in the center, deep below the surface. The voices are clearer now, unmistakably human and filled with fear and hope.

replies.text: What's this? There are people down there!

message: Look! Someone's here! Help us!
We're down here! Please, you have to get us out!
Thank you Feygard, they have found us!

replies.text: [Thinking]I really need to talk to these people.

message: Please! We need your help.
Wait, you are not a Feygard soldier!
No matter! We need you to find a way to free us.

replies.text: How did you guys get down here?
How long have you people been down here?

message: Go kill the giant troll that is holding us here. Then come back here to free us.
What?! No, no, no. I will not talk details right now.
Did you find something to free us from this pit?

replies.text: Matter a fact, I have. But what I have will require a lot of effort on you guys' end.
Not yet, but I'm working on it.

message: What is it?

replies.text: It's a rope. I will tie one end to this here rock and throw down the other end to you. I hope you guys have the strength to do it.

message: We'll do anything. Please go ahead and drop the rope.
We are finally free!
Human, why you come here? Gamjee no hurt you if you leave now.

replies.text: I'm just exploring. Who are you, and why are you here?

message: Human, why you come here? Gamjee no hurt you if you leave now.

replies.text: I've found the people you captured. You need to let them go.

message: Gamjee guard well. Humans come, take Gamjee's well, build village. They no ask. They just take. Gamjee scared. Need protect well. You help Gamjee?

replies.text: You're afraid they'll come back and take more?
I thought I heard somes voices earlier. Have you hurt anybody recently?

message: Yes! Humans take all if no stop. Gamjee alone. If you help, tell humans Gamjee no bad. Maybe they listen. Maybe they share well, no fight. You help, no need for hurt.

replies.text: I understand. I'll help you find a peaceful solution.

message: No! Gamjee protect! If humans come back, they take all. Gamjee alone, scared.

replies.text: I don't believe you! I can't take that risk. This ends now

message: Gamjee has grasped his last breath when you realize that you really need to follow those voices.
Gamjee has grasped his last breath and now it's time to rescue those people.
Captured? No, no! Gamjee protect them! Humans take Gamjee's well, build village. They no ask. They just take. Gamjee keep them safe here. You see, they not hurt.

replies.text: Keeping them in a pit isn't protecting them. It's imprisoning them.

message: No! Listen! Humans come, take Gamjee's well, leave Gamjee with nothing. Gamjee scared. If Gamjee let them go, they come back, take well again. They no understand, well is life for Gamjee. Please, you help. Tell humans Gamjee no bad. Maybe they listen. Maybe they share well, no fight. You help, no need for hurt.

replies.text: I see. You acted out of fear and desperation. I'll help you find a peaceful solution.

message: You help Gamjee? Humans no hurt?

replies.text: I'll do what I can. Let's talk to the villagers.
I'll do what I can. Let's talk to the villagers.
I'll do what I can. Let's talk to the villagers.

message: Let Gamjee call human with magic water.

replies.text: OK. Now that I have you two together, let's talk about how you guys can reach a compromise and share the well water.

message: Why should we trust him? He's been keeping us captive!

replies.text: Gamjee is afraid you'll take the well. He wants to protect it.

message: And what about us? We need water too.
Gamjee not want hurt. Humans need water. Gamjee need too.

replies.text: Is there a way you can share the well? Maybe take turns using it?

message: We can agree to that. As long as Gamjee doesn't threaten us anymore.
Gamjee promise. No hurt. Protect well. Humans share. No fight.

replies.text: So our busy here is done?

message: You human, go back village now.

replies.text: So our busy here is done?
So our busy here is done?

message: Not same. Take rope, use to free others from pit.
OK.

replies.text: Let's talk about how you guys can reach a compromise and share the well water.

message: Why you still here? Leave now.
take shiny thing back.
Please meet us back to Wexlow Village.
Bye.
Didn't you find us after visiting our village and our well?
Yes, that place. I am leaving now. I will see you there.
Too bad this tree is in the way.
Oh, our hero returns to us.

replies.text: I'm just happy to see you guys safe.

message: I'm just happy to curl up with Godwin in our own bed tonight.
It's very nice to see you again.
Have you by any chance seen my weeding ring? Oh my, Godelieve is going to kill me when she sees it's missing.
Um, let me think. Oh, yeah, I remember. It's black, gold and covered in emeralds.

replies.text: "Oh, yeah, I remember"? What? Don't you know what it lookis like?
Actually, this is your lucky day. I have it here.

message: Leave me alone. I don't need you questioning me under this stressful situation.
Your messing with me, right? Give it to me, please.

replies.text: What do you want to give me in exchange for your wife not "killing you"?

message: Thank you so much! Here take these coins.
Give you? How about 2000 gold coins?

replies.text: Hey Godelieve, did you hear what happened to Godwin?

message: No. What happened.
NEVER MIND! Godelieve, this kid is being silly. You can go back to whatever it is that you were doing.
Fine! Take the coins you thief.
What good are you to these people if you're down there with them?

Ah, these are Enchanted Coins, crafted by ancient wizards who once drew magic from the well’s waters. The runes on these coins change patterns, a sign of their magical origin. Such artifacts are rare indeed.

replies.text: What can you tell me about their enchantment?

message: The coins hold a faint echo of the well's enchantment. Though their magic is subtle, they carry the essence of the well's power. As a token of my gratitude for bringing these to me, I offer you this rare artifact in exchange for three of these coins. It is imbued with protective magic, much like these coins.

replies.text: Without knowing more about this "rare artifact", I'm afraid that I will have to pass on your offer.
Umm, I guess I can trust you now.

message: Well, if you change your mind, I will be here.

For your effort in retrieving these valuable coins, take this rare artifact. It is a relic from the same era as the coins, crafted with similar enchantments. It will serve you well in your journeys, offering protection and a touch of ancient abilities.
Hsss!
How can I help you today?

replies.text: What is going on with that cat?
I would like to make a purchase, please.

message: Well, you see, he's my guard cat.
Yes. If you attempt to rob me, he'll attack you. Hence he is my guard cat.
No, not seroiusly. He guards my fruits and vegetables.
I have a business agreement with him. He guards my food from the rats in exchange for a place to sleep.

replies.text: Oh, why didn't you just say so?

message: I wanted to waste your time just as you are doing to my time. Walking up to my business counter asking about my cat! Get lost, kid.
This is my place of business. Right here on the side of Duleian Road.

replies.text: Why here? There's nothing else here besides you.

message: Oh, you silly child. This is a very well traveled road. All the people coming and going from and to Feygard. It's a long road and they get hungry.

replies.text: OK, you sell found. What kind of food?

message: I sell things that a child such as yourself is most likely not interested in.

replies.text: I am not a child anymore!!

message: I sell fruits and vegetables.

replies.text: As an adult, I am interested in seeing what you have.
Where do you get these fruits and vegetables?

message: From all over Dhayavar, but mostly from the great farmers in Loneford.

replies.text: Oh, yeah. I've seen all of their great farms.
